page.title: 20POSTMAN & TELEPHONE
page.content: Postman - Mr Archer. Not born in Witnesham but has lived here all his life. Went to school at Witnesham Area School near Church from age 5 to age 14. Teachers were Miss Ena Cotton, Mrs Eastew, Mrs Walters. Miss Ena Cotton taught 3 generations & her sister cooked dinners there. Punishments were caning and lines. Shop near school entrance run by Miss Maggie Mason. There were a lot of tramps about. Before the 1939/45 war there was a smithy near the Barley Mow Inn kept by a family from Tuddenham called Norman. He has seen the disappearance of the Mill and the windmill on Mow Hill. Telephones-Telephone Exchange has approx 550 lines, 5 public kiosks, 13 farms mainly served by underground cables. Main road takes main cables which feed Debenham & Ipswich.
